Package com.intellij.codeInspection

Interface GlobalInspectionContext

  • All Superinterfaces:
    UserDataHolder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    GlobalInspectionContextBase, GlobalInspectionContextEx, GlobalInspectionContextImpl

    public interface GlobalInspectionContext
extends UserDataHolder
    The context for a global inspection run. Provides access to the reference graph and allows to enqueue external usage processing.
    See Also:
    GlobalInspectionTool.runInspection(AnalysisScope, InspectionManager, GlobalInspectionContext, ProblemDescriptionsProcessor), GlobalInspectionTool.queryExternalUsagesRequests(InspectionManager, GlobalInspectionContext, ProblemDescriptionsProcessor)

    • Method Detail

      • getRefManager

        RefManager getRefManager()
        Returns the reference graph for the global inspection run.
        Returns:
        the reference graph instance.

      • shouldCheck

        boolean shouldCheck(RefEntity entity,
                    GlobalInspectionTool tool)
        Checks if the inspection is suppressed for the specified reference graph node. Should not be called manually in normal case. You need to check suppressions only when you use GlobalInspectionTool.runInspection(com.intellij.analysis.AnalysisScope, com.intellij.codeInspection.InspectionManager, com.intellij.codeInspection.GlobalInspectionContext, com.intellij.codeInspection.ProblemDescriptionsProcessor)
        Parameters:
        entity - the reference graph node to check.
        tool - the inspection to check.
        Returns:
        true if the inspection is suppressed, false otherwise.

      • isSuppressed

        boolean isSuppressed(PsiElement element,
                     java.lang.String inspectionToolId)
        Checks if the inspection with the specified ID is suppressed for the specified PSI element.
        Parameters:
        element - the PSI element to check.
        inspectionToolId - the ID of the inspection to check.
        Returns:
        true if the inspection is suppressed, false otherwise.
